intro: Ecbolium divergens f. minus, commonly known as the lesser sandwort, is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It features small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple, blooming in early spring. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain water in dry environments. Its root system is shallow but extensive, allowing it to thrive in sandy or gravelly soils. Ecbolium divergens f. minus plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
